fields.title: Airdrop
fields.definition: Free distribution of tokens to promote adoption.

fields.title: Altcoin
fields.definition: Any cryptocurrency other than Bitcoin.

fields.title: Atomic Swap
fields.definition: Technology to exchange cryptocurrencies without intermediaries.

fields.title: Bear Market
fields.definition: Market condition with falling prices and pessimism.

fields.title: Bitcoin
fields.definition: The first and most popular cryptocurrency.

fields.title: Block
fields.definition: A group of transactions recorded on a blockchain.

fields.title: Blockchain
fields.definition: A digital ledger of all transactions in a network.

fields.title: Bull Market
fields.definition: Market condition with rising prices and optimism.

fields.title: Cold Wallet
fields.definition: A cryptocurrency wallet stored offline for security.

fields.title: Consensus Mechanism
fields.definition: Method of achieving agreement on blockchain data.

fields.title: Crypto Exchange
fields.definition: Platform to buy, sell, and trade cryptocurrencies.

fields.title: Cryptography
fields.definition: Mathematics used to secure transactions and wallets.

fields.title: DAO
fields.definition: Decentralized Autonomous Organization for governing blockchain projects.

fields.title: DeFi
fields.definition: Decentralized financial services on public blockchains.

fields.title: Degen
fields.definition: A risky, speculative crypto investor.

fields.title: DEX
fields.definition: Decentralized Exchange that works without a central authority.

fields.title: DApp
fields.definition: Decentralized Application running on a blockchain.

fields.title: Difficulty
fields.definition: A measure of how hard it is to mine a block.

fields.title: Ethereum
fields.definition: Blockchain platform for smart contracts and DApps.

fields.title: Fiat
fields.definition: Government-issued currency like the US Dollar.

fields.title: Fork
fields.definition: Split in a blockchain protocol creating a new chain.

fields.title: FOMO
fields.definition: Fear of Missing Out, often drives panic buys.

fields.title: FUD
fields.definition: Fear, Uncertainty, Doubt - negative sentiment tactic.

fields.title: Gas Fees
fields.definition: Transaction fees on Ethereum and similar blockchains.

fields.title: Genesis Block
fields.definition: The very first block of a blockchain.

fields.title: Halving
fields.definition: A 50% reduction in mining rewards on Bitcoin.

fields.title: Hash
fields.definition: A fixed output generated from input data using algorithms.

fields.title: Hashrate
fields.definition: Measure of computational power in mining.

fields.title: HODL
fields.definition: Hold On for Dear Life - to not sell.

fields.title: Hot Wallet
fields.definition: A crypto wallet connected to the internet.

fields.title: ICO
fields.definition: Initial Coin Offering - a form of fundraising.

fields.title: IEO
fields.definition: Initial Exchange Offering run by crypto exchanges.

fields.title: KYC
fields.definition: Know Your Customer - identity verification process.

fields.title: Layer 1
fields.definition: Base blockchain architecture like Ethereum or Bitcoin.

fields.title: Layer 2
fields.definition: A secondary protocol built on top of a blockchain.

fields.title: Liquidity
fields.definition: How easily a crypto can be bought or sold.

fields.title: Liquidity Pool
fields.definition: A collection of tokens locked in a smart contract.

fields.title: Market Cap
fields.definition: Total value of a cryptocurrency's circulating supply.

fields.title: Mining
fields.definition: Using computers to secure and verify transactions.

fields.title: Minting
fields.definition: Creating a new token or NFT.

fields.title: Moon
fields.definition: Slang for a crypto rapidly increasing in value.

fields.title: Multisig Wallet
fields.definition: A wallet that needs multiple signatures to authorize a transaction.

fields.title: Node
fields.definition: A computer participating in a blockchain network.

fields.title: NFT
fields.definition: Non-Fungible Token - a unique digital asset.

fields.title: Oracles
fields.definition: Services that bring external data into blockchains.

fields.title: P2P
fields.definition: Peer-to-peer interaction without intermediaries.

fields.title: Private Key
fields.definition: A secret code to access your wallet.

fields.title: Proof of Stake
fields.definition: Consensus mechanism based on staking crypto.

fields.title: Proof of Work
fields.definition: Consensus mechanism based on computing power.

fields.title: Public Key
fields.definition: Used to receive cryptocurrency, paired with private key.

fields.title: Pump and Dump
fields.definition: Inflating price then selling quickly for profit.

fields.title: Rekt
fields.definition: Slang for someone who lost big in crypto.

fields.title: Rug Pull
fields.definition: Scam where developers abandon a project after funding.

fields.title: Satoshi
fields.definition: Smallest unit of Bitcoin (0.00000001 BTC).

fields.title: Scamcoin
fields.definition: A cryptocurrency with fraudulent or no purpose.

fields.title: Sharding
fields.definition: Splitting blockchain into smaller parts to increase scalability.

fields.title: Shill
fields.definition: Promoting a crypto for personal gain.

fields.title: Smart Contract
fields.definition: Self-executing contracts with coded terms.

fields.title: Stablecoin
fields.definition: Cryptocurrency pegged to stable assets like USD.

fields.title: Staking
fields.definition: Locking crypto to earn rewards or secure a network.

fields.title: Token
fields.definition: A unit of value on a blockchain.

fields.title: TVL
fields.definition: Total Value Locked in DeFi protocols.

fields.title: Validator
fields.definition: Node that validates transactions in PoS blockchains.

fields.title: Volatility
fields.definition: How much the price of a crypto changes.

fields.title: Wallet
fields.definition: Tool to store, send, and receive cryptocurrency.

fields.title: Web3
fields.definition: Decentralized internet powered by blockchain.

fields.title: Whale
fields.definition: Investor holding a large amount of crypto.

fields.title: Wrapped Token
fields.definition: Tokenized version of another crypto asset.

fields.title: Yield Farming
fields.definition: Earning rewards by lending crypto in DeFi.

fields.title: Zero-Knowledge Proof
fields.definition: Proof method that reveals no private data.

fields.title: ZK-Rollup
fields.definition: Layer 2 scaling using zero-knowledge proofs.

fields.title: Cross-Chain
fields.definition: Interaction between different blockchain networks.

fields.title: DAICO
fields.definition: A model combining DAO and ICO.

fields.title: Dusting Attack
fields.definition: Sending tiny amounts of crypto to trace wallets.

fields.title: Escrow
fields.definition: Third-party holding funds for secure transactions.

fields.title: Flash Loan
fields.definition: Uncollateralized loan that must be repaid in a transaction.

fields.title: Hard Fork
fields.definition: A permanent split from the main blockchain.

fields.title: Impermanent Loss
fields.definition: Loss due to providing liquidity in volatile pairs.

fields.title: Ledger
fields.definition: A record of all blockchain transactions.

fields.title: Lightning Network
fields.definition: Bitcoin Layer 2 for faster, cheaper transactions.

fields.title: MEV
fields.definition: Miner Extractable Value - profit from transaction ordering.

fields.title: Merkle Tree
fields.definition: Data structure used for verifying blockchain data.

fields.title: Nonce
fields.definition: A number used once in mining.

fields.title: Paper Wallet
fields.definition: A physical print of your wallet keys.

fields.title: Presale
fields.definition: Buying tokens before public launch.

fields.title: Rebase Token
fields.definition: Token that automatically adjusts supply.

fields.title: Security Token
fields.definition: A token that represents real-world financial assets.

fields.title: Sidechain
fields.definition: A separate blockchain that connects to the main chain.

fields.title: Slippage
fields.definition: Difference between expected and executed price.

fields.title: Snapshot
fields.definition: A record of wallet balances at a specific time.

fields.title: Synthetic Asset
fields.definition: Token that mimics the value of a real asset.

fields.title: Testnet
fields.definition: Blockchain network used for testing.

fields.title: Time-Lock
fields.definition: A smart contract that restricts access to funds until a certain time.

fields.title: Tor
fields.definition: Network for anonymous internet access, used with crypto.

fields.title: Utility Token
fields.definition: Token used to access a product or service.

fields.title: Vesting
fields.definition: Locking tokens until certain conditions are met.

fields.title: Watchlist
fields.definition: List of tracked cryptocurrencies.

fields.title: Whitelisting
fields.definition: Granting pre-approval to participate in token sales.

fields.title: Yield Aggregator
fields.definition: Tool to optimize DeFi yields.
